text: Doesn't the Clear Styles function take care of this? It works for me to remove inline styles like font-weight, font-size, etc.

Thanks for the examples! I'm talking with the team about it now. We're going to be making some updates to how we do paste processing over the next couple weeks and I can look into whether the proposed changes will cover this or whether we can make further changes to fix.

This definitely isn't a long-term solution, but this Chrome Extension let's you right click and copy as Plain Text. Easier than copying into notepad and then again into the WYSIWYG. <https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/copy-as-plain-text/hmjdnojobglgfjhfdeamomnjdlfcmogl>
What is the best practice for setting a cap on the number of fields a custom module has? Has anyone seen performance issues with particularly lengthy modules?
I’ve only seen really bad lag when I’ve implemented a “paste SVG code” field

Interesting, what about the number of fields that you have created rather than the user’s input data? Have you done more than 100 fields? 50? Etc. (In my case the user would only fill out 20 of [potentially] 130 fields).

fwiw, internally at HS we’ve experimented with modules containing >100 fields. I didn’t run into any noticeable performance issues in the handful of modules I wrote (besides the negative UX of a lot of scrolling for the user)
If you do see performance dips though I’d be curious to hear about it.
theres nowhere this css is being declared in our stylesheets so i dont know where to find this to make this nor have padding
its also saying the css is declared on the page itself and not from a css file... thoughts?
thanks <@U7UBMQMDK>, that was super helpful. I’ll let you know
